#January6 was one of our nation's darkest days. We will leave no stone unturned in our efforts to hold the perpetrators accountable and ensure nothing like it ever happens again.

700+ rioters have been arrested & 160+ have pleaded guilty. And while justice is delivered to those who broke the law, @January6thCmte has been working around the clock to determine exactly what led to the attack & uncover every detail of the security failures that followed.

These attempts to whitewash the insurrection are extremely dangerous. Bad actors have continued to gin up more hate, making the January 6th attacks feel like just an appetizer of more to come. We have an obligation to prevent that from happening.

I‚Äôm angry that 5 officers died from the day's trauma, with hundreds injured. I‚Äôm mad that my colleagues ‚Äî knowingly pushing a lie that led to the violence ‚Äî still voted to overturn the election results. And I‚Äôm furious that many of them downplay the damage for political benefit.
But I‚Äôll be honest ‚Äî I‚Äôm still extremely angry about what happened on #January6.

One year later, I'm deeply grateful for the courageous actions of the @CapitolPolice, city, state and federal law enforcement officials & the National Guard who defended the Capitol Building and ensured that we could return safely to the House Floor to certify the election.

It feels like just yesterday that we were barricaded in my office as a violent mob attacked the Capitol, beat police officers, broke windows & doors, and held the seat of our Democracy hostage ‚Äî all in an attempt to overturn the 2020 election & the will of the American people. https://t.co/clh0EuO5kY
